Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2015 07:37AM caprivaida wrote: Thank you all,i called the doctor yesterday the nurse said the doctor would read the report that they have it and he would get back in touch with me.The doctor who came in to review ultrasound findings just said it was my nipple i am feeling but i do not think so,she made me feel as if i am stupid because she asked me was i talking about the little tiny bumps that we all get on areola the ultrasound tech even shook her head and said no she is not talking about that.I was told by the radiologist technician that they don't do biopsy behind the nipple but she put in report consider surgical consultution she wrote the beside of what she checked which was no signs of breast cancer we recommend mammogram yearly starting at age 40.I hope my doctor will send me to a surgeon and not make me wait a year and this lump i feel be cancer and grow by then.Octogirl did they see your cancer behind your nipple on mammo or ultrasound all that she felt she said and sees is the nipple because its inverted slightly?Thanks again and i am so sorry to hear that yours was cancer:(
Posts.Title: lump under nipple on left breast caprivaida caprivaida

Posts.Content: caprivaida wrote: hi,im 38 years old i have 5 kids my littlest is almost 7 months old i only breast fed her at birth one day only.i have been having discharge with i thought was just milk so i just didn't worry with it but then i felt a lump under my nipple and the nipple it self goes inverted some times but does not stay that way ,i went to my doctor he did feel the lump so he sent me for diagnostic mammogram the mammogram was normal but i need a ultrasound because they do not see the lump on the mammogram my mother had breast cancer at 50 triple negative is what she had and her aunt had breast cancer and past away at 31 years old and two cousins on her side as well.my questions is could i have cancer and the mammogram not pick it up?i also have a copy of my report.CLINICAL DATA: Patient describes a retroareolar knot on the left with occasional left milky discharge EXAM: DIGITAL DIAGNOSTIC BILATERAL MAMMOGRAM WITH CAD COMPARISON: 10/11/2011 ACR Breast Density Category b: There are scattered areas of fibroglandular density. FINDINGS: No significant mammographic abnormality on either side. Stable scattered benign appearing bilateral round calcifications. Tangential spot compression view over the left nipple is normal. Mammographic images were processed with CAD. IMPRESSION: The patient requires left breast ultrasound but could not be scanned today due to Medicaid status. RECOMMENDATION: The patient will return in 1 week for left breast ultrasound. I have discussed the findings and recommendations with the patient. Results were also provided in writing at the conclusion of the visit. If applicable, a reminder letter will be sent to the patient regarding the next appointment. BI-RADS CATEGORY 0: Incomplete. Need additional imaging evaluation and/or prior mammograms for comparison. Electronically Signed please any advice i'm so scared i don't know what any of that report means thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: lump under nipple on left breast caprivaida caprivaida

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2015 07:59AM caprivaida wrote: Thank you Meadow for replying to me,i had the ultrasound today and the doctor who looked it over said that she thinks what im feeling is just my nipple because it is sorta inverted but my doctor felt the lump the same lump i felt and said it was the size of a bean which is why he sent me for mammogram. The doctor wrote in my report to see surgical consultution giving my concern about left nipple so i guess now its up to my obgyn to send me to or not.I am still worried i told her about the discharge and she said it was normal as long as i didn't have to squeeze to get it to come out i had read on line the opposite.The nipple discharge i was having came out on it's own but i could also squeeze it to get it to come out as well and it was a yellow color which then turned to clear with some red in it like blood too which was maybe because i kept squeezing it,I am still concerned because i know i feel something there i will admit i never much did any breast exam on my self until i seen the discharge so maybe it was like that before but the doctor has done breast exam on me before and never noticed it ,im so confused about this she also told me my breast look fine on mammogram not dense but my paper i was giving said i had dense breast.What should i do now if my doctor doesn't refer me to a breast surgeon?My mind is still not at ease
